alert.note: Alert for Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 26 at 4:41PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Pike County through 530 PM CDT... At 441 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Brantley, or 7 miles southeast of Luverne, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Troy, Goshen, Springhill, Mossy Grove and Henderson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
